Articles.Content:
So I've tried to build some big craft to explore Eeloo and stuff, and once I did, I was happy to explore the whole system. 
but it wasn't enough
So I downloaded To Boldly Go, which requires Kopernicus.
And once I downloaded Kopernicus, I booted up the game, and made a new save file. 
But I'm stuck on the loading screen! The planets keep orbiting the Sun! 
It was fine before this. What can I do?
P.S no crash logs, it didn't crash

I'm not 100% sure on this, but it might be due to ModuleManager errors because any in-game objects being replaced/replicated causes that if not done properly. I've seen KottabosGames and other people make this mod work, so I suspect that either you're using the wrong Kopernicus version or the wrong game version since TBG has been updated to 1.3. You can either hook up with either @daniel l. or @seanth about this if my suspecting mind is wrong, they know way more about procedural generation than I do.

Edited August 11, 2017 by NickRoss120

On 7/21/2017 at 2:23 AM, leroket said:

So I've tried to build some big craft to explore Eeloo and stuff, and once I did, I was happy to explore the whole system. 
but it wasn't enough
So I downloaded To Boldly Go, which requires Kopernicus.
And once I downloaded Kopernicus, I booted up the game, and made a new save file. 
But I'm stuck on the loading screen! The planets keep orbiting the Sun! 
It was fine before this. What can I do?
P.S no crash logs, it didn't crash

 

Did you open the Executable file in the To_Boldly_Go folder? TBG is an independent app that generates a universe.

I'm currently in transit from one geographic location to another and don't have access to anything that would let me help troubleshoot. I should have access to a real computer by Monday or Tuesday, and can looksie then

On 8/11/2017 at 4:37 PM, daniel l. said:

Did you open the Executable file in the To_Boldly_Go folder? TBG is an independent app that generates a universe.

yes.I tried deleting Thesaurus or whatever, adding 3 different galaxies *no attempts worked*
 

 

On 8/11/2017 at 1:19 PM, NickRoss120 said:

I'm not 100% sure on this, but it might be due to ModuleManager errors because any in-game objects being replaced/replicated causes that if not done properly. I've seen KottabosGames and other people make this mod work, so I suspect that either you're using the wrong Kopernicus version or the wrong game version since TBG has been updated to 1.3. You can either hook up with either @daniel l. or @seanth about this if my suspecting mind is wrong, they know way more about procedural generation than I do.

I've tried with different Kopernicus versions. Even deleted MM. Nothing worked.
Playing with 1.3

36 minutes ago, leroket said:

yes.I tried deleting Thesaurus or whatever, adding 3 different galaxies *no attempts worked*

3 different galaxies? TBG only generates 1. Are you trying to use cluster mode? That mode has always had serious issues.

Thesaurus?

On 8/14/2017 at 4:44 PM, daniel l. said:

3 different galaxies? TBG only generates 1. Are you trying to use cluster mode? That mode has always had serious issues.

Thesaurus?

Same problem, same galaxy type, will test soon.
